author: RickRobinson
title: Charles Payne Has Had Quite Enough of Biden Treating MAGA as Less Than American (WATCH)
text:
In this video, Charles Payne has a lot to say. He seems to be coming to terms with the Left's new philosophy: If you aren't for us, you are against us.
EXPLOSIVE: Charles Payne (â€” Simon Ateba (@simonateba)
[@cvpayne]) EXPLODES on Fox News over Biden's 'hatred' for MAGA, demeaning them, painting them as racists, attacking them, not considering them to be Americans, when they simply want a safe home and community, better USA. WATCH [pic.twitter.com/6IPR4nXkty] [January 24, 2024]
It is odd to hear someone who ran as the person who would unite us all again decrying half of the country as terrorists. It seems Payne, like most of you, just not Jessica, has had more than enough.
Hey, Jessica Tarlov, please stop defending Biden. He hates half of America, and you must to if you defend him.â€” AppSame (@AppSame)
[January 24, 2024]
According to Biden and the Left, that is a resounding no.
Calling people MAGA extremists is so odd since there's nothing extreme about a large percent of the nation that wants American greatnessâ€” Eliza Johnson (@elizjohns13)
[January 24, 2024]
Ah, but it isn't, you see. One is no longer supposed to be proud to be American. By extension, one should neither strive for her to be great nor believe that she ever was.
The Left has taught everyone who will listen to view the world through the lens of the oppressed and the oppressors. America is the great oppressor and, therefore, shouldn't be admired but deplored and reshaped not in the name of equality but equity.
Biden is the most divisive man in political office. He doesnâ€™t want Patriotism, unity, love for our country. He wants spread hate and keep people focused on hate. Sorry. â¤ï¸ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸â¤ï¸â€” TiredofTyranny061 (@homesteader1000)
[January 24, 2024]
Recommended
There is so much truth here, dear reader, but it isn't just Biden. Division has been the name of the game for quite some time. All we can do is use our discernment to make the best decisions and stand up when called. Also, each of you should keep trying to make your corner of the world the best it can possibly be.
***

author: Marie Edinger
title: Missile manufacturing company warned of potential for explosion ahead of fire that injured 5: Report | FOX 35 Orlando
text: The Brief A fire at the Aerojet Rocketdyne facility in Orlando injured five people, including two burn patients and one with hazardous material inhalation. The blaze, caused by ignited lithium powder, prompted evacuations and the isolation of a nearby neighborhood due to toxic fumes. Officials are investigating the incident at the facility, which manufactures propulsion technology for the Department of Defense and NASA. ORLANDO, Fla. - A fire with toxic fumes injured five people at an Aerojet Rocketdyne facility in Orlando. Two of those people were rushed to Orlando Regional Medical Center (ORMC) as trauma alert burn patients; one was a hazmat inhalation patient. The Orlando Fire Department also had to work on evacuations, and isolate a nearby neighborhood to keep them safe from toxic smoke. Wesley Walker, who works right across the street from the facility that caught fire, was shocked by what he saw when he arrived. "Fire trucks and news stations are everywhere. I donâ€™tâ€™ know whatâ€™s going on, but itâ€™s kind of crazy." Orlando Fire says lithium powder â€“ not a battery, but a material the company uses in manufacturing â€“ is what started the blaze. "It requires a very specific and disciplined procedure to extinguish the fire and get control," said Assistant Orlando Fire Chief Walter Lewis. L3Harris took over Aerojet Rocketdyne in 2022. MORE HEADLINES: Message in a bottle makes it from Florida to Texas - and will keep going Disney announces new experiences at EPCOT International Festival of the Arts Man posing as Volusia County official arrested for scamming $48K worth of Starlink kits from vendor: deputies Shockingly high number of young voters say UnitedHealthcare CEO's murder was "acceptable" That new owner told me today this particular facility, "Designs and produces sophisticated ballistic missile targets and undersea propulsion technology." Orlando Fire is still investigating what exactly caused the lithium powder to ignite. "It doesnâ€™t take much â€“ sometimes friction, sometimes a high heat source," said Assistant Chief Lewis. In a report to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, Aerojet Rocketdyne warned, "Our business operations involve the handling, production, and disposition of potentially explosive and ignitable energetic materials and other dangerous chemicalsâ€¦. A release of these chemicals or an unplanned ignition or explosion could result in death or significant injuries to employees and others. Material property damage to us and third parties could also occur." People FOX 35 talked with who work right across the street said they had no idea thatâ€™s what the company did. "Thatâ€™s a little concerning," Walker said after learning about the company. Aerojet Rocketdyne says sales to the U.S. government makes up about 95% of their work. Those sales are mostly to the Department of Defense and NASA. And these are not small contracts â€“ the DOD has a $1.2 billion contract with this exact facility for guided missile and space vehicle explosive propulsion units, solid fuel, and components; plus two contracts totaling about $200 million for operational systems development of missile and space defense systems. L3 Harris did not respond to a request to interview. author: Jacob Wallin
title: Killeen ISD theatre students set records at Texas Thespian State Festival
text:
KILLEEN, Texas â€” Students from [Killeen ISD](https://www.killeenisd.org/)'s theatre program made district history this November at the [Texas Thespian State Festival](https://www.texasthespians.org/) in Grapevine.
Multiple students earned top marks in various categories, several for the first time in district history, as well as receiving a record amount of scholarship offers, said Killeen ISD.
According to Killeen ISD, students from [Ellison](https://tx02205734.schoolwires.net/ehs), [Harker Heights](https://tx02205734.schoolwires.net/hhhs) and [Chaparral](https://tx02205734.schoolwires.net/Page/115) High Schools helped achieve the milestones, with 14 earning superior scores from all three judges in their respective events and advancing to the [National Thespys](https://schooltheatre.org/thespys/) competition.
Students who qualified for the National Thespys are:
- Junior Michael Manley â€“ Harker Heights High School â€“ Monologue
- Junior Ava Morgan â€“ Chaparral High School â€“ Monologue
- Junior Kaitlyn Dooley â€“ Chaparral High School â€“ Monologue
- Junior Xiana Melendez â€“ Chaparral High School â€“ Monologue
- Senior Asher Harris and Junior Marlee Luther â€“ Chaparral High School â€“ Duet Acting
- Junior Armie Melton â€“ Chaparral High School â€“ Solo Musical
- Junior Jessiel Rosario and Henry Kreinbrink â€“ Chaparral High School â€“ Duet Musical
- Juniors Hadassah Moon and Zachary Repine â€“ Chaparral High School â€“ Duet Musical
- Senior Olivia Hopson â€“ Ellison High School â€“ Makeup Design
- Senior Emely Fernandez â€“ Chaparral High School â€“ Lighting Design
These students are now reportedly invited to compete at the [International Thespian Festival](https://schooltheatre.org/event/international-thespian-festival-2024/) at Indiana University in June 2025.
Juniors and seniors from the program also reportedly received over 160 college callbacks and secured more than $333,000 in scholarship offers, the highest amount in Killeen ISD history.
Some of the other notable achievements include:
*Indicates a first in Killeen ISD history
- Junior Kaitlyn Dooley â€“ Chaparral High School â€“ Improv Challenge All-Star Performer*
- Junior Armie Melton â€“ Chaparral High School â€“ State Student Thespian Officer Candidate
- Junior Ava Morgan â€“ Chaparral High School â€“ Mainstage Callback Performer, Perfect Score*
- Junior Armie Melton â€“ Chaparral High School â€“ Mainstage Callback Performer, Perfect Score*
- Senior Emely Fernandez â€“ Chaparral High School â€“ $1,000 Texas Thespian Scholarship Recipient*
According to Killeen ISD, the Texas Thespian State Festival provides opportunities to experience live theatre from across the state, participate in workshops, audition for colleges and employers and compete in individual events.
â€œWe commend our theatre directors for their dedication and support in making these opportunities possible for our students,â€ Morganne Davies, assistant director for Fine Arts, said. â€œWe look forward to continued growth and increased participation in the years ahead."

author: Katelyn Mitchell Jewett
title: Why Like A Dragon: Pirate Yakuza's Animals Are Standout Characters
text:
Yakuza games typically feature a large cast of characters, and Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii is no exception. There are dozens of characters Goro Majima can recruit to join the Goro Pirates, including both new and returning faces. In addition, there are rival pirate crews, Honolulu shopkeepers, inhabitants of the peaceful Rich Island, and many more. But one group of characters is among Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii's best: the animals who Goro Majima can rescue and bring to the "Goro Animal Kingdom" on Rich Island.
Related
How Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaiiâ€™s Substories Enrich Goro Majimaâ€™s Character Arc
Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaiiâ€™s substories are a pivotal part of the game's overarching narrative, as they help flesh out Majima's character.
Each Animal Has A Unique Personality And Rescue Scene
Throughout the game, Goro Majima is given the option to rescue various animals around Hawaii. These range from cats and dogs to birds and even a chimpanzee. Once an animal has been rescued, it moves to the Goro Kingdom, where it can be fed things like Pet Food in exchange for items such as cooking ingredients. However, these animals do more than simply provide Majima with ingredients to use at the Goro Goro Kitchen. Each one has its own distinct personality, shown through its rescue scene and the name Goro or Noah gives it.
Each animal stands out and truly feels unique. Allure the cat is a fancy, pampered feline previously owned by a hostess, and will only join the Goro Kingdom if Majima approaches her in his Goromi disguise. Gourmand the dog has fancy tastes and will eat only Wild-Caught Sashimi. And CoCo, the chimpanzee whose origins are extremely unclear, is a tricky fellow who will not approach Majima until he has exhausted every available dialogue and action option.
Seeing Majima interact with, rescue, and name these animals - and later feed them in his Kingdom - is truly heartwarming. It shows a softer side to the rough-and-tumble yakuza turned pirate captain, as he is unfailingly kind and gentle towards every creature he rescues. Even those which give him trouble, like Zoomies the dog - who needs to be chased around Shipper's Wharf before he joins up - are offered a new home in the Goro Kingdom without question. Seeing Majima as an animal lover is a new side to this iconic and beloved character, as Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii truly lets players get to know him in a way they never had before.
Goro The Tiger Cub Is The Star Of The Show
Of course, the most iconic and memorable of the many animal characters encountered throughout Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii is Goro, the tiger cub who serves as Majima and Noah Rich's companion throughout the game. Goro - who shares a name with Majima out of pure coincidence, as Noah simply thought he "looked like a Goro" - is the king of the Goro Kingdom, a benevolent ruler who treats all his subjects with kindness and fairness.
Unlike the other animals, Goro does not stay in the Kingdom, but accompanies Majima on his journeys throughout Honolulu, Madlantis, and on the open sea. He can help out Majima in many ways: he can catch insects and other ingredients for use in the Goro Goro Kitchen, and even participates in combat. One of the biggest examples of Majima's soft side for animals is the fact that he can dress Goro up to match him, giving him a hat, eye patch, or adorable bow. This adorable tiger cub has quickly become one of the most memorable and popular characters in Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii, a role he absolutely deserves for his usefulness, adorable relationship with his owners, and cute appearance - especially when dressed up.
-
